events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th, involving a rear-end collision at a traffic light.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident following review of the initial report and vehicle damage details.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle this vehicle collision case.
The insured party was contacted and the claim acknowledgement was sent via email, confirming receipt and next steps.
Requested police report, vehicle repair estimates, and photos of the accident damage from the claimant to proceed.
The insured submitted all requested documents including police report, repair shop invoices, and accident photos.
An investigation was initiated by the claims department to verify details of the car collision and liability.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault and damages were as reported.
A settlement amount was proposed based on the repair estimates and policy coverage for the auto accident claim.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claims process.
The claim approval was issued confirming the agreed settlement amount to be paid to the insured.
Payment for the approved settlement was processed and sent to the insured's registered bank account.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation of claim resolution.
All documentation and case files were archived for this car collision claim following closure of the case.
